posts.html:
@Hand_Bannana & NicodemusCromwell
Loops only cause a draw if there's no way for them to end. A mandatory loop that will somehow break itself eventually will play out for however many steps that takes. In this case it breaks itself by causing your opponent to loose the game. If you have more than one opponent the loop will kill all of them, because Sanguine Bond has you pick a target opponent each time it's triggered.

The only way it would cause an infinite loop is if your opponent has some way of surviving unlimited life loss. Such as Phyrexian Unlife.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: UncreativeNameMaker (5/3/2012 1:44:46 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I know everyone is talking about this, and thinking it's all good and all...  
  
But allow me to do something completely unpredictable: compare it to [Angel's Mercy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angel's Mercy)  
  
Let's look at it: Exquisite Blood allows you to gain life whenever your opponent loses like. If they were playing a deck without any life gain, that's 20 life in the end! Amazing!  
  
Well... not so much. First, you have to deal the damage. Ok, that's usually not a problem.  
  
But the main problem is that Exquisite Blood is a 5 CMC enchantment that you need to wait to gain life, while [Angel's Mercy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angel's Mercy) is a 4 CMC instant that just gains you 7 life immediately. If you were to get up to Angel's Mercy's level, you'd need to deal 7 damage without Exquisite Blood getting destroyed.   
  
I understand that once you've gained 7 life, you've dealt 7 damage, but that's not Exquisite Blood's effect: all it simply does is gain you life.   
  
All I see here is a slow life-gain card for singleplayer. Play it in Mu... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: FirstPrime you seem very close minded. You wont play with people who use combo decks? Some combo's I can see. But this plus the Sanguine Bond? That's 2 five mana enchantments that can be wrecked by 2 mana instants. You act like once they drop either enchantment everyone in the world just lost. In truth the combo is weak unless your whole deck supports it. And even then it can be broken. This combo is the same as attacking with 200+ combined power and trample. But that decks, okay right? Cuz creatures can die, enchantments can't.

Its everything i have waited and hoped for- truly, it is the zenith win-condition i have hoped for with such immaculate synergy with that of [Sanguine Blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sanguine Blood) to include in my Orzhov deck, a flavorful combination to say the very least.  
  
Well done Wizards; Sometimes, we, as a community give you quite a bit of crap, and i myself am far from innocent- yet then you come along and surprise us with the good fortune of fun cards like these, and you manage to convince us to stick around till the next set ruins our fun with Titans and Jaces...

posts.post_content:
There is a mini-burn combo with [Stuffy doll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stuffy doll) here in Monoblack decks.   
  
First, play the doll and declare the opponent. Play this, then play [Death Wind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Death Wind) on your stuffy doll. What was ordinarily intended to be a black creature removal, has now become a black burn spell =)
posts.html:
There is a mini-burn combo with Stuffy doll here in Monoblack decks.

First, play the doll and declare the opponent. Play this, then play Death Wind on your stuffy doll. What was ordinarily intended to be a black creature removal, has now become a black burn spell =)

Posted By: MechaKraken (6/24/2012 10:38:41 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card is better in limited than people are giving it credit for. I've been running black pretty heavy in my last few drafts as it has been woefully untouched by most of the other players and it has been a huge boon for me. People (in my area, anyway) just seem to neglect anti-enchantment spells meaning this thing can stay on the table for quite a while and in a primarily black deck it isn't hard to maintain enough of a card advantage to slip this out on turn 5 or 6 without giving up much to your opponent.   
  
I think the price is fair and it can be a powerful, sometimes even demoralizing, card in the right deck. It's a solid 4/5
